subject: Communication
title: Oxytocin: The Story Chemical
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Oxytocin: The Story Chemical.

hook.text: Paul Zak drew blood before and after people watched an emotional story. Oxytocin levels spiked dramatically.

buildup.text: Oxytocin is the 'empathy hormone' ‚Äî it increases trust, generosity, and emotional connection.

discovery.text: Character-driven stories with tension produced the most oxytocin. Flat narration produced none.

twist.text: After watching emotional stories, people donated 56% more money to charity than a control group.

climax.text: Stories literally change our body chemistry ‚Äî making us more compassionate and willing to help strangers.

punchline.text: A good story doesn't just move you emotionally. It moves your chemistry.

quiz.question: What hormone do character-driven stories increase?
